titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Boyd and Philip D. Yeiser, Summons
CWG9041

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Lyon Circuit Court
June Term 1862
The Commonwealth Pltff
agst } Summons on forfeited Recognizance
Wm Boyd and P D Yeiser &c Deft

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth, and the Summuns issued herein having been returned executed on Wm Boyd & P D Yeiser and they having failed to answer It is adjudged by the Court that the Plaintiff the Commonwealth of Kentucky recover of the defendants Wm Boyd and P D Yeiser The sum of Two hundred dollars the amount specified in the recognizance with interest thereon at the rate of 6 per cent per annum from this date until paid & also the Cost expended herein &c

A true Copy
att A. H Dudley Clk
Lyon Circt Court.
